comments:
I am using the new API openLaunchConfigurationDialog, passing a config type.
When the dialog comes up, the config type got selected, then I click on NEW
and then try to leave, by clicking on a different type let's say.
A dialog comes up asking if I want to save: yes, no, cancel.
I choose NO, that's when it gets the exception.
It doesn't happen when I am using the usual launch config mechanism.

Robert, I created an action that calls DebugUITools.openLaunchConfigurationDialog() and 
sets the selection to be a config type, but I cannot duplicate the problem following the steps you 
listed.  The stack trace suggests that in the array of ILaunchConfigurationTab's that is 
provided by the tab group, one of them is null.  I've looked, but couldn't find any framework code 
that nulls out entries in this array.  Is there any chance that your tab group could somehow cause 
any entry in the array to be null?  If not, are there any other details you can provide to help 
reproduce this?  I did my testing on 20020521.
Robert, is it OK to close this bug?

I was on course last week and didn't have time to look at this.
If you cannot reproduce, close it.  I will try again with the lastest F2
and if it does happen again I will check in my code what you suggest
might be happening and will take it from there.
